DGACM.relevance_comment: Requests the Secretary‑General, when implementing page limits for the Commission’s documentation, to take into account the Commission’s specific mandate and functions. This is a directive to the Secretary‑General on documentation policy that would be implemented by the Secretariat’s documentation and publishing services. DGACM’s PPB (subprogramme 3: Documentation services) explicitly states responsibility for delivering multilingual documentation services, applying quality/timeliness requirements and implementing documentation-related mandates, so this paragraph creates an obligation on the Secretary‑General that DGACM would operationalize (e.g., through how page limits are applied in document processing and issuance).

Directly requests the Secretary‑General to continue publication of Commission standards and to provide summary records of Commission meetings (including committees of the whole). Publication and provision of summary records fall within DGACM’s mandated functions (subprogramme 3: Documentation services; subprogramme 4: Meetings and publishing services), so this paragraph places a concrete task on the Secretary‑General that DGACM is responsible for implementing (i.e., continuing to publish Commission texts and to produce/provide summary records in the official languages).
